# URLError.NetworkUnavailableReason

**Enumeration**

An enumeration of reasons explaining why a task couldn’t satisfy networking constraints.

## Declaration

```swift
enum NetworkUnavailableReason
```

## Overview

The network may be unavailable due to restrictions placed on the [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/URLSessionConfiguration], such as [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/URLSessionConfiguration/allowsConstrainedNetworkAccess], [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/URLSessionConfiguration/allowsExpensiveNetworkAccess] and [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/URLSessionConfiguration/allowsCellularAccess].

## Unavailability reasons

- **URLError.NetworkUnavailableReason.cellular**: A reason that indicates network is unavailable because the interface is cellular and cellular network is disabled.
- **URLError.NetworkUnavailableReason.constrained**: A reason that indicates network is unavailable because the user enabled “Low Data Mode” in the Settings app.
- **URLError.NetworkUnavailableReason.expensive**: A reason that indicates network is unavailable because the system marked the interface as expensive.

## Enumeration Cases

- **URLError.NetworkUnavailableReason.ultraConstrained**

## Error details

- **failingURL**: The URL which caused a load to fail.
- **failureURLPeerTrust**: The state of a failed SSL handshake.
- **failureURLString**: The string for the URL which caused a load to fail.
- **downloadTaskResumeData**: An opaque data object used to resume a failed download task.
- **backgroundTaskCancelledReason**: The reason for canceling a background task.
- **URLError.BackgroundTaskCancelledReason**: An enumeration of reasons used to explain the cancellation of a background task.
- **networkUnavailableReason**: The reason the network was unavailable for a task.

## Conforms To

- Copyable
- Equatable
- Hashable
- RawRepresentable
- Sendable
- SendableMetatype
